alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 17 at 1:35PM CST until December 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Illinois and east central, northeast, and southeast Iowa. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects, including holiday decorations. Tree limbs could be blown down leading to isolated power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will move through tonight accompanied by an abrupt increase in northwest winds. The front will reach areas north of I-80 between 10 PM and midnight, and south of I-80 between midnight and 2 AM. In addition to the strong wind gusts, occasional flurries and a few isolated snow showers are possible. The windy conditions will continue through the day on Monday, gradually decreasing through the late morning and early afternoon.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Secure outdoor objects.
